intro: Manihot dulcis var. flabellifolia, commonly known as the sweet potato leaf plant, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by woody, spindle-shaped fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are widely used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
